Print the location in memory of a data frame

Source: R/location.R
location.Rd

This is useful for understand how and when dplyr makes copies of data frames

location(df)

changes(x, y)

Arguments

df

a data frame
x, y

two data frames to compare

Examples

location(mtcars)
#> <0x563f8bb3ec48>
#> Variables:
#>  * mpg:       <0x563f8f9863b0>
#>  * cyl:       <0x563f8f9864f0>
#>  * disp:      <0x563f8f986630>
#>  * hp:        <0x563f8f986770>
#>  * drat:      <0x563f8f9868b0>
#>  * wt:        <0x563f8f9869f0>
#>  * qsec:      <0x563f8f986b30>
#>  * vs:        <0x563f8f986c70>
#>  * am:        <0x563f8f986db0>
#>  * gear:      <0x563f8f986ef0>
#>  * carb:      <0x563f8f987030>
#> Attributes:
#>  * names:     <0x563f8bb3ecf8>
#>  * row.names: <0x563f8f987170>
#>  * class:     <0x563f8bcb82b8>

mtcars2 <- mutate(mtcars, cyl2 = cyl * 2)
location(mtcars2)
#> <0x563f88327bb8>
#> Variables:
#>  * mpg:       <0x563f8f9863b0>
#>  * cyl:       <0x563f8f9864f0>
#>  * disp:      <0x563f8f986630>
#>  * hp:        <0x563f8f986770>
#>  * drat:      <0x563f8f9868b0>
#>  * wt:        <0x563f8f9869f0>
#>  * qsec:      <0x563f8f986b30>
#>  * vs:        <0x563f8f986c70>
#>  * am:        <0x563f8f986db0>
#>  * gear:      <0x563f8f986ef0>
#>  * carb:      <0x563f8f987030>
#>  * cyl2:      <0x563f9354ebc0>
#> Attributes:
#>  * names:     <0x563f88327a58>
#>  * class:     <0x563f8bb8bcc8>
#>  * row.names: <0x563f8e4dcee8>

changes(mtcars, mtcars)
#> <identical>
changes(mtcars, mtcars2)
#> Changed variables:
#>           old     new           
#> cyl2      <added> 0x563f9354ebc0
#> 
#> Changed attributes:
#>           old            new           
#> names     0x563f8bb3ecf8 0x563f88327a58
#> row.names 0x563f8f987170 0x563f85ca31e8
#> class     0x563f8bcb82b8 0x563f8bb8bcc8
